storyInfo: After the club where they hang out is set on fire, Tecno and her artist friends defy their oppressors in their own way.

attributes.content: Experimental rock, one vote... acid jazz, one vote...
attributes.name: Club Owner

attributes.content: ...Death metal, one vote.
attributes.name: Club Owner

attributes.content: Same thing as yesterday, folks. We still don't have a genre set for this week's theme.
attributes.name: Club Owner

attributes.content: Debate time starts... now.
attributes.name: Club Owner

attributes.content: Sullivan! You promised me you would vote for death metal after watching that black box performance!
attributes.name: Tecno

attributes.content: But the freedom of electronic music is the sound of the future!
attributes.name: Sullivan

attributes.content: I'll pay you back for your ticket—
attributes.name: Sullivan

attributes.content: Once I've sold my new work.
attributes.name: Sullivan

attributes.content: You really think the price of two measly tickets can match the everlasting impression that incredible concert left on your soul?
attributes.name: Tecno

attributes.content: Change your vote.
attributes.name: Tecno

attributes.content: I—
attributes.name: Sullivan

attributes.content: I'm afraid that's not possible.
attributes.name: Street Sculptor

attributes.content: To stop people from adding votes on their own, the boss told me to make the scoreboard from metal this time.
attributes.name: Street Sculptor

attributes.content: The boss gave me a budget, so I had to make do with the harder, cheaper kind. Only problem is, I need to use an electric drill to write the scores.
attributes.name: Street Sculptor

attributes.content: *sound of drilling*
Seriously though, shouldn't we just stop with the voting at this point?
attributes.name: Sullivan

attributes.content: Rigged voting boxes, voice-controlled score panels, even attempted mass hypnosis... the cheating methods get more outlandish and scarier each time.
attributes.name: Sullivan

attributes.content: Last time, 'Maestro' juggled ten pieces of Originite Prime in one hand to draw our attention while changing the score with the other hand, just so Leithanian folk music would win.
attributes.name: Sullivan

attributes.content: The scariest part is that it worked.
attributes.name: Club Owner

attributes.content: Which is why 'Maestro' doesn't get to nominate anymore.
attributes.name: Street Sculptor

attributes.content: *sound of drilling*
Huh? What did you say?
attributes.name: Sullivan

attributes.content: One vote... Just one vote, again...
attributes.name: Tecno

attributes.content: It's just like it was back underground.
attributes.name: Tecno

attributes.content: No one understands my taste in art! I can't take it anymore!
attributes.name: Tecno

attributes.content: Come on, Tecno, don't be angry, you're my favorite customer.
attributes.name: Club Owner

attributes.content: But a community has to have rules. You know how hard it is to get these avant-garde artists to play nice with each other.
attributes.name: Club Owner

attributes.content: Even if your choice of music doesn't win, everybody's artwork gets to be displayed in the club for free, including your little puppet.
attributes.name: Club Owner

attributes.content: I know...
attributes.name: Tecno

attributes.content: Besides, well, death metal is a little—
attributes.name: Club Owner

attributes.content: A little what?!
attributes.name: Tecno

attributes.content: *sound of drilling*
Knock it off, Sculptor! You can tally later!
attributes.name: Tecno

attributes.content: *sound of drilling*... ecno... Tecno... wake up...
Who is it this time? You'll do anything to keep me from winning, huh?
attributes.name: Tecno

attributes.content: ...most of the fire has been extinguished... removing beams... passed out from smoke inhalation...
Hey, do you smell that?
attributes.name: Sullivan

attributes.content: ...Tecno! Can you hear me, Tecno?!
attributes.name: Firefighter

attributes.content: I warned you kids to keep flammables away from the wires. The wiring in the club is a mess!
attributes.name: Firefighter

attributes.content: What am I saying... it's my fault. I should've known you wouldn't throw away your artwork.
attributes.name: Firefighter

attributes.content: ...Diaz...? Papá?
attributes.name: Tecno

attributes.content: Bueno, you're awake! Paramedics will be here soon. I'm so glad you weren't badly hurt.
attributes.name: Diaz

attributes.content: Death metal... theme day...
attributes.name: Tecno

attributes.content: Don't speak. You need rest.
attributes.name: Diaz

attributes.content: Sullivan... Jefe... The others...
attributes.name: Tecno

attributes.content: We're here at the scene of the fire.
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: Firefighters are on site, but rescue efforts are taking longer than expected due to the remote location.
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: As the fire spreads, residents in the local community are trying to fight it on their own. Let's interview some of the people affected.
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: Hello. Condolences on your loss. Do you know how the fire started?
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: Save the condolences. Shut your mouth and do something useful!
attributes.name: Sullivan

attributes.content: Nobody ever cared about fires in this community. We've never had reporters like you in here before.
attributes.name: Sullivan

attributes.content: It seems this community has been a fire risk for many years. Frequent fires, abandoned scrap... all have a significant impact on the surrounding areas.
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: What are you getting at?
attributes.name: Sullivan

attributes.content: The fire has nothing to do with our art!
attributes.name: Sullivan

attributes.content: It's true that we have to resort to scavenging scrap for our artwork because we don't have the money, but that doesn't mean we put any less artistic expression into it.
attributes.name: Sullivan

attributes.content: These street artists have no care or concern for the public. Despite knowing full well that their work is completely worthless, they continue to act with the extreme selfishness that has led to this tragedy—
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: I'll teach you to talk like that!
attributes.name: Sullivan

attributes.content: Uh... Despite their failure as artists, it seems their true talent lies in violence. It's hard to fathom how this group of unkempt vagrants claims to be artists.
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: Sullivan! Stop! He's trying to provoke you. This is live TV.
attributes.name: Tecno

attributes.content: Did you forget how media spin lost us our only sponsor?
attributes.name: Tecno

attributes.content: I know! But I just can't stand these people coming to jeer at us at a time like this!
attributes.name: Sullivan

attributes.content: The club just got renovated. We painted the wall brush by brush.
attributes.name: Sullivan

attributes.content: That Originium kinetic device next to the bar cost Sculptor two years of savings. It was going to an exhibition next month, might even get its own column in Art Review... but now?
attributes.name: Sullivan

attributes.content: Ahem... these hoodlums have intentionally placed flammable items such as paper, wood, and Originium products beneath aging circuitry, perhaps as some kind of perverted 'artistic expression'.
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: Without proper oversight, however, such disasters will only continue to repeat themselves.
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: There have been more and more 'accidents' lately, ever since the businessmen and military announced the acquisition plan for this spot.
attributes.name: Sullivan

attributes.content: Can you really not tell who sent that fraud of a 'reporter'?
attributes.name: Sullivan

attributes.content: ...As we can see, what the tenants call a 'cradle of art' is nothing more than a collection of fire hazards.
attributes.name: Reporter's Voice

attributes.content: Many upstanding members of society are willing to take up the rebuilding of this art community, and do their part for the development of Dossoles.
attributes.name: Reporter's Voice

attributes.content: The military, in particular, is leading the charge...
attributes.name: Reporter's Voice

attributes.content: Bravo, Captain Mateo! Even those hoodlums wouldn't dare cross the line now that the press has its eyes on them.
attributes.name: Obsequious Soldier

attributes.content: Hmph. The money-grubbers think all we know is how to shoot a gun, that we'd be no match for them when it comes to the acquisition plan.
attributes.name: Mateo

attributes.content: But I've got much more experience than they do in dealing with those troublemakers of the art community.
attributes.name: Mateo

attributes.content: You said it, sir.
attributes.name: Obsequious Soldier

attributes.content: If that reporter does his job, we'll drive these worthless tramps out of the community without having to pay compensation.
attributes.name: Mateo

attributes.content: They may put on a tough face, but deep in their hearts, they thirst for recognition. Let's see what they think they can do, once we burn their nest to the ground.
attributes.name: Mateo

attributes.content: Your cunning is matched only by your courage, sir! It's just a matter of time before that land is ours.
attributes.name: Obsequious Soldier

attributes.content: ...This selfish, immoral behavior endangers the homes of countless innocent citizens.
attributes.name: Reporter's Voice

attributes.content: Here we have a child who was just rescued from the fire. Let's ask her how she feels.
attributes.name: Reporter's Voice

attributes.content: Where are your mama and papa, little girl? Are you in pain?
attributes.name: Reporter's Voice

attributes.content: Who are you calling... little girl...?
attributes.name: Restrained Voice

attributes.content: No need to act tough, kiddo. We're here to show the world how terrible those scary hoodlums are. We'll help you get back home... ouch!
attributes.name: Reporter's Voice

attributes.content: Who are you calling 'little girl'?! You call yourself a reporter when you don't even know what a Durin looks like?!
attributes.name: Angry Voice

attributes.content: G-Get off me, you brat!
attributes.name: Reporter's Voice

attributes.content: Turn off the camera, you idiot! Pull this psycho off me!
attributes.name: Reporter's Voice

attributes.content: O-Okay!
attributes.name: Cameraman's Voice

attributes.content: Hmph... they're tough, I'll give them that.
attributes.name: Mateo

attributes.content: Y-You're absolutely right, sir.
attributes.name: Obsequious Soldier

attributes.content: Ugh... that kid sure was strong for her size.
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: Sir, I can't get the interior of the club from this angle.
attributes.name: Intern Cameraman

attributes.content: You've got legs for a reason. If you can't shoot it from the outside, go in.
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: The fire's been burning for a few hours since we started shooting. They managed to put the one at the club out, but the two neighboring apartments aren't so lucky.
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: Ha! All the better. The bigger the fire, the more sensational the photos, and the more likely this will make the headlines!
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: Hold it right there.
attributes.name: Tecno

attributes.content: Sorry about that. We just want a couple of photos for a Society Tribune special. We'll leave once we have them.
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: Don't think I'm oblivious to your scheme. You use our charred artwork to grab attention, then turn the public against us to drive us out!
attributes.name: Tecno

attributes.content: Now, now, what's with the slandering? How often does your, er, 'artwork' get a chance to be seen in newspapers and TV?
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: It's great exposure. You might even get famous, if you're lucky!
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: What kind of artist would happily subject her artwork, that she poured her heart and soul into, to the fires of the media?!
attributes.name: Tecno

attributes.content: Heart and soul? Pfft. This trash you call 'artwork' was a disaster even before the fire! If anything, it's an improvement—
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: You don't know anything about art!
attributes.name: Sullivan

attributes.content: Sure, I'm just an ordinary viewer, but viewers have the right to their opinions too.
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: Clumsy brushwork, rough effects... even a third-rate amusement park's haunted house wouldn't take this crap.
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: At least now it has some value.
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: After all, isn't it you artists who say that ashes are beautiful too?
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: How dare you!
attributes.name: Tecno

attributes.content: Get out of my way. You can't stop me.
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: I believe I can.
attributes.name: Diaz

attributes.content: You're the fireman who came to fight the fire on his own?
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: So noble! Here's my card. Please, give me a call if you're interested in doing an exclusive.
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: Now, if you would excuse me...
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: The scene has not yet been secured.
attributes.name: Diaz

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: A comprehensive check is required to prevent secondary damage. We request your cooperation with firefighting efforts.
attributes.name: Diaz

attributes.content: As far as I know... the fire department doesn't have any personnel assigned to the art community. You're overstepping, don't you think?
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: And as far as I know, electric sparks don't make clean cuts like these, aging circuits or not. Besides, I don't think our reporters are this... efficient, don't you think?
attributes.name: Diaz

attributes.content: Hmph.
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: This isn't over.
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: Umm, sir? Why did the streetlights go out? It's pitch black here... I'm starting to get the creeps.
attributes.name: Intern Cameraman

attributes.content: This is all the fault of that stupid firefighter. We'll go once we've got our photos of the scene.
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: Let's see how smug these hoodlums are when photos of their 'artwork' are all over the press.
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: Hey, where's the club? Did we take a wrong turn?
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.text: A musbeast dashes past their feet in the dark alley.
In his fright, the rookie cameraman accidentally turns on the camera light, illuminating a rugged concrete wall.

attributes.content: Sticky red liquid... it's still dripping... C-Could it be...?
attributes.name: Intern Cameraman

attributes.content: Hmph! Those hoodlums splatter a few geometric figures with red paint and call themselves avant-garde. And they say I'm the one who doesn't know anything about art.
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: Art is not about form, but how it evokes emotions.
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: Joy, sorrow, anger, fear... true art strips away all the masks that the viewer is wearing, commanding total immersion with its power.
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: A height these people will never reach.
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: I didn't know you were such a connoisseur.
attributes.name: Intern Cameraman

attributes.content: You saw how things were during the day. Those artists are like walking Catastrophes. Who knows what they'd do if they caught us?
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: I've already arranged with the station to get the video on air as soon as the storage card arrives. And we'll get our 'bonus' once Captain Mateo sees it.
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: Good call!
attributes.name: Intern Cameraman

attributes.content: Wh-What's that sound?!
attributes.name: Intern Cameraman

attributes.content: Come on, boy, look at the time, you should be in bed... my eyelids are drooping...
attributes.name: Sound from Left Window

attributes.content: The fire really spooked him, dear. Be patient.
attributes.name: Sound from Left Window

attributes.content: Look at you, getting all riled up over a couple putting their boy to bed.
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: The owner of the club said it was arson.
attributes.name: Sound from Left Window

attributes.content: I'll wring the neck of whoever did it. Look how our baby's hair got singed...
attributes.name: Sound from Left Window

attributes.content: Baby...
attributes.name: Intern Cameraman

attributes.content: You're not scared of a little kid, are you?
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: No... I mean... there's a kid standing on the corner... and it seems to be... glowing?
attributes.name: Intern Cameraman

attributes.content: But the moon isn't out!
attributes.name: Intern Cameraman

attributes.content: Wh-What is it? Why is it looking at us?
attributes.name: Intern Cameraman

attributes.content: S-Stop letting everything scare you! Can't you see it's not moving? Probably some scrap the hoodlums left here.
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.text: The words have barely left his mouth when the 'child' innocently cocks its head, at an angle that should not be possible.
One step, two steps... it, or 'he' starts running towards them with an eerie smile on his face.

attributes.content: D-Do normal children run that fast?
attributes.name: Intern Cameraman

attributes.content: L-Let's get out of here for now...
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: ...Intern?
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: This is not what I expected for my first day on the job!
attributes.name: Intern Cameraman

attributes.content: Why you son of a...! Wait for me! And don't you drop that camera!
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: You're getting better and better at manipulating your puppets, Tecno.
attributes.name: Sullivan

attributes.content: Got to thank the painter couple that lives on the second floor. They were furious at the fright that the fire gave their pet fowlbeast.
attributes.name: Tecno

attributes.content: Third-rate amusement park's haunted house, eh? We'll show them what artists can do when they're pissed.
attributes.name: Tecno

attributes.content: Art is about evoking emotions, eh? We'll show them how art can evoke this little emotion called 'fear'.
attributes.name: Tecno

attributes.content: Get the boys ready, Sullivan. We're just getting to the good part.
attributes.name: Tecno

attributes.content: *pant* *pant* I... I wanna go home...
attributes.name: Intern Cameraman

attributes.content: Papá says children killed by fire become angry ghosts! This one must be here for revenge!
attributes.name: Intern Cameraman

attributes.content: Oh, shut up... W-We didn't do anything wrong...
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: Are you out of your mind? Why are you laughing?! We won't get any pictures if we wake the locals!
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: It wasn't me! I-It's him... he's coming for us!
attributes.name: Intern Cameraman

attributes.content: I thought our wires burned in the fire. How did you get that sound?
attributes.name: Sullivan

attributes.content: Turrión built a makeshift generator out of an exercise bike.
attributes.name: Tecno

attributes.content: Cool!
attributes.name: Sullivan

attributes.content: He's not submitting a new work for our project tonight?
attributes.name: Sullivan

attributes.content: He is. The title is 'Turrión on Bike'.
attributes.name: Tecno

attributes.content: His specialty is performance art, after all.
attributes.name: Tecno

attributes.content: Dead end... We're done for...
attributes.name: Intern Cameraman

attributes.content: Pull yourself together! It's just some stupid parlor trick. Get your camera ready. We're getting that bonus from Captain Mateo!
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: Aw! Ouch... Quit hiding behind me!
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: I-It wasn't me!
attributes.name: Intern Cameraman

attributes.content: I think... there's somebody... behind us...
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.text: It is the shadow they see first.
It stretches from their feet to the entrance of the alley, cutting off all possibility of escape.
The reporter can feel his neck go stiff. Still, he cannot help but turn his head to look and see just what terror awaits him.
He spies a horrifying visage, its terrible mouth gaping open, exuding a charred stench.
Its jaw creaks ominously as it opens and closes, delivering a chilling question from beyond the grave—

attributes.content: YESSSEEEEEEKKK—
attributes.name: Intern Cameraman & Reporter

attributes.content: I see. The sculpture's head is now driven by wind power rather than Originium, but the instability makes it feel even more alive.
attributes.name: Tecno

attributes.content: Gotta give Turrión his due. The projections wouldn't have worked nearly as well, if not for him on the bike controlling the output.
attributes.name: Sullivan

attributes.content: He should get a side job generating electricity.
attributes.name: Sullivan

attributes.content: And I should thank that reporter too. A complete amateur, but what he said about beauty did give me some new inspiration.
attributes.name: Street Sculptor

attributes.content: I salvaged the transmission from the club, while trying out some new things with the interplay of light and shadow.
attributes.name: Street Sculptor

attributes.content: I'm planning to submit this sculpture for next week's exhibit. I think it'll be a smash hit!
attributes.name: Street Sculptor

attributes.content: Trying out new things...
attributes.name: Tecno

attributes.content: You know, I've always been interested in all kinds of music.
attributes.name: Tecno

attributes.content: I know, Tecno, but I don't have the money to pay you back for the tickets right now.
attributes.name: Sullivan

attributes.content: No, that's not what I meant...
attributes.name: Tecno

attributes.content: What I mean is, are you up for a collab song?
attributes.name: Tecno

attributes.content: What was that? Why do I feel like someone's whispering in my ear when there's no one there?!
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: Hey, I like this synthesizer.
attributes.name: Tecno

attributes.content: M-My brain's all jumbled... Will we ever get out of this place?
attributes.name: Intern Cameraman

attributes.content: Hell yeah! You hear the eight bars of dissonance? Planned by yours truly.
attributes.name: Sullivan

attributes.content: HELLLLLLLP—
attributes.name: Intern Cameraman & Reporter

attributes.content: Gotta hand it to you too, Tecno... Didn't know you could sound so... guttural!
attributes.name: Sullivan

attributes.content: I see light! We're outta here! Screw Mateo's bonus!
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: *cough* I've wanted to try that forever.
attributes.name: Tecno

attributes.content: More into it now? I'll take you to my favorite heavy metal band's next gig. No excuses the next time we vote.
attributes.name: Tecno

attributes.content: Deal! But only if you do my vocal sampling for my next track!
attributes.name: Sullivan

attributes.content: Deal!
attributes.name: Tecno

attributes.content: Hey, where did they go?
attributes.name: Sullivan

attributes.content: *pant*... *pant*... how did these two... *pant*... end up... *pant*... over here...?
*pant*... *pant*... And... *pant* they're out cold...
attributes.name: Turrión

attributes.content: The conversion of... *pant* kinetic energy... *pant* into... *pant* electric energy... *pant*... is so tiring... *pant*... Tecno!
attributes.name: Turrión

attributes.content: Good work, Turrión.
attributes.name: Tecno

attributes.content: I knew I was right to save you for last.
attributes.name: Tecno

attributes.content: Yikes, muchacho, you almost scared the daylights out of me!
attributes.name: Sullivan

attributes.content: You look like a corpse that just got trawled out of a lake... what happened to your clothes?
attributes.name: Sullivan

attributes.content: Hehe... *pant*... the sacrifices we make... *pant*... in the name of art...
attributes.name: Turrión

attributes.content: What do we do now?
attributes.name: Sullivan

attributes.content: You know, screams aside, this kid's pretty handy with a camera.
attributes.name: Tecno

attributes.content: It's not often the community comes together to put on a show like this. It'd be a shame if only two people got to see it.
attributes.name: Tecno

attributes.content: Hey, didn't they say they would put the video on air as soon as it arrived?
attributes.name: Tecno

attributes.content: Tecno? What are you doing by yourself here when everyone else is celebrating at the party?
attributes.name: Sullivan

attributes.content: You see the reaction to the broadcast?
attributes.name: Tecno

attributes.content: Absurdist, horror, farce... people are calling it all sorts of things, but at least the TV station won't be back for a very long time.
attributes.name: Sullivan

attributes.content: Doesn't mean we can rest easy, though.
attributes.name: Tecno

attributes.content: There are a lot of people with designs on our turf. They don't see value in street art; all they want to do is to run this bunch of 'unproductive vagrants' out of town.
attributes.name: Tecno

attributes.content: Yeah... Today's party is a farewell for some of us.
attributes.name: Sullivan

attributes.content: It's tough enough that doing art costs so much with so little recognition in return. If we also have to constantly fear for our safety, things will get really hard...
attributes.name: Sullivan

attributes.content: At this rate, who knows when the club will reopen again...
attributes.name: Tecno

attributes.content: Excuse me...
attributes.name: Curious Tourist

attributes.content: Are you the street artists from the late-night show on TV?
attributes.name: Curious Tourist

attributes.content: That's us.
attributes.name: Tecno

attributes.content: Wow! Can I get a picture with you? My friends and I love the artwork in that short!
attributes.name: Curious Tourist

attributes.content: I'm not an artist, so I can't explain why I like them with technical terms. But I can feel certain emotions, like the release of pent-up frustration and a sense of self-mockery... Sorry if I got any of that wrong...
attributes.name: Curious Tourist

attributes.content: You... you really do like our artwork?
attributes.name: Tecno

attributes.content: Yes!
attributes.name: Curious Tourist

attributes.content: Which piece is your favorite?
attributes.name: Sullivan

attributes.content: My favorite...?
attributes.name: Curious Tourist

attributes.content: Hey, what's with all the people...?
attributes.name: Curious Tourist

attributes.content: Please give us a sec.
attributes.name: Tecno

attributes.content: Good thing the scoreboard survived the fire.
attributes.name: Tecno

attributes.content: Voting is not over yet, friends. Just because my choice of music didn't win doesn't mean my artwork won't!
attributes.name: Tecno

attributes.content: Our artwork.
attributes.name: Sullivan

attributes.content: If you like the mix track, cast your vote for the first and last numbers.
attributes.name: Sullivan

attributes.content: Here, girl, take the drill.
attributes.name: Sullivan

attributes.content: So cool! Is this some kind of new interactive installation?
attributes.name: Curious Tourist

attributes.content: Just a little idea of mine.
attributes.name: Street Sculptor

attributes.content: By the way, if you like the sculpture over there, vote for the number in the middle.
attributes.name: Street Sculptor

attributes.text: In front of the collapsed club, the worn-out music player continues to play back the peculiar collab track, attracting a crowd of onlookers.
Tecno brings out her little puppets for her campaign, while the Sculptor scribbles on the ground with chalk.
Pepe Turrión is about to take off his clothes again, but is stopped by the other artists.
Holding each other's hands, two charred little puppets dance around the feet of the crowd to the background music.
If I make the puppets bigger, perhaps they'll reach more eyes, Tecno mused. Maybe then, I'll discover there are more people out there who truly understand us.
One day, they will dance on a bigger stage.
